item.title: call
item.description: Call a closure. When assigned to a variable, it is not required to explicitly write the call function. Simply calling the closure by using () will work as well. This function does not generate a change. Function closure.call() Arguments The arguments for the closure. If more arguments are given than the closure expects, the redundant arguments will be ignored. If too few arguments are given, then the remaining arguments will be set to nil.

item.title: doc
item.description: Returns a doc string from a closure. An empty string ("") is returned if the closure has no doc string. This function does not generate a change. Function closure.doc() Arguments None Return value Returns the doc string. Example This code creates a closure with a doc string: add_one = |x| { "Adds one to a given value."; x+1; }; // Return the doc string add_one.doc(); Return value in JSON format
